article_title: Charles Lipson: Congress Can Pry Open a Clammed-Up IRS
article_text: The White House and IRS are entangled in a sticky court case with major political ramifications. It concerns allegations that the IRS illegally shared private taxpayer information with the White House related to conservative individuals or organizations. The Treasury Department said this month that although it has found a cache of documents that may be pertinent, it is not allowed by law to release them. The question now is who can find out whether the Obama White House has in effect weaponized the IRS, turning it into an agency...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Charles Lipson says the IRS is pleading that it can’t share documents that it may have shared illegally with the White House because that would be illegal.
twitter.title: Congress Can Pry Open a Clammed-Up IRS

image.alt: How Congress Can Pry Open a Clammed-Up IRS

article_summary:
The question now is who can find out whether the Obama White House has in effect weaponized the IRS, turning it into an agency...
The White House and IRS are entangled in a sticky court case with major political ramifications.
It concerns allegations that the IRS illegally shared private taxpayer information with the White House related to conservative individuals or organizations.
The Treasury Department said this month that although it has found a cache of documents that may be pertinent, it is not allowed by law to release them.
